sentence.Network_en: He dropped gracelessly into a chair opposite her.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一屁股坐在她对面的椅子上，姿势非常不雅。

sentence.Network_en: The task fell to Mr Harris to deliver this bad news. It was gracelessly done.
sentence.Network_cn: 宣布这一坏消息的任务落到了哈里斯先生身上，结果他处理得很不妥当。

PerfectNetExp.abs: I hate teaching!!!!!!! ... stumble vi. 跌跌撞撞地走 gracelessly ad. 不优美地，笨拙地 grace n. 优美；风度.
I hate teaching!!!!!!! ... stumble vi. 跌跌撞撞地走 gracelessly ad. 不优美地，笨拙地 grace n. 优美；风度.

entry.tran: 不优美的；难看的；不吸引人的
entry.def: Something that is graceless is unattractive and not at all interesting or charming.

example.ex: It was a massive, graceless house.
example.tran: 这是一间非常难看的大房子。

entry.def: A graceless movement is clumsy and uncontrolled.

entry.tran: 不懂礼貌的；粗鲁无礼的
entry.def: If you describe someone as graceless, you mean that their behaviour is impolite.

example.ex: She couldn't stand his blunt, graceless manner.
example.tran: 她无法忍受他的唐突和粗鲁。

baesInfo.ciba_translate_msg: 以上结果来自机器翻译。
